lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons and Dragons, or are a little late on the draw when shouting the phrase out, Travis Willingham. (laughs) Anyway, before we get into tonight's episode, let's go ahead and jump into our announcements. Let's see here, we've got a new game called Injustice 2 that just came out.

lines.name: TRAVIS, ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait a minute. What is this Injustice 2 you speak of?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that the shapes and pie-making game that you play in the kitchen bakery?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like Cooking Mama.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I watched a video today of you and you fighting, which was pretty exciting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, we have all the Flashes covered, I think.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All of the Flashes are on this show.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's crazy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So who do you guys play?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I play Barry Allen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I play Reverse-Flash. What's his name?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eobard Thawne.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I play Supergirl!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I play Tim Garrick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Jay Garrick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jay Garrick. I wear a tin pail for a helmet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty slick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The one Flash I don't know, really.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next Halloween, man. Just saying. I'd love a picture of you wearing that hat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, check it out, it looks really good. They had us all do really intense facial motion capture which is even funnier, considering that my character wears a mask the whole time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did they really make you do that?

lines.name: MATT, TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With a mask?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, not with a mask on my face, but yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would've been even better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I assume there'll be a DLC costume where he doesn't have a mask, or they just did it to fuck with me, which I respect either way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're in the booth, going (whispers) we're not getting any of this!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't tell him! Let it roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just draw a dick-butt on his forehead; it's fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Those bright lights are headache-inducing, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So check it out. It's out now, it's fun! What I've seen of it looks actually really cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've played a little; it's fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They got their RPG in my fighting game, and that's right up my alley. All right, also, because it's coming up real fast, reminder, MomoCon, May 25th to the 28th. MoMocon! Taliesin, Marisha, myself, and Brian W. Foster are going to be there for a Talks Machina panel, as well as other events throughout the weekend, so look forward to seeing you there in Atlanta, Georgia, weekend after this one. Also, I will be at A-Kon once again, June 8th to the 11th in Fort Worth, Texas. Come say hello to me there. And then, remember that Talks Machina is live on Tuesdays at 7PM Pacific Time here on Twitch and Alpha. The submission email has changed, so to submit your gif and/or fanart of the week, use submit@talksmachina.com. So that is submit, submit! One submit, not two, that's just my psychosis. Submit@talksmachina.com. Yes. Anything else anyone wants to talk about, are we good? Move on to the game for the night.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Farpoint came out. So if you have PlayStation Virtual Reality System, then you can get Farpoint, and I play Dr. Eva Tyson on it, and it's actually a really freaking cool game.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's fun, you shoot things with a gun. Do you have to get the gun for it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I liked the story a lot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not how guns work.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: Are we talking about next week?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, yeah, we should say that, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a big one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That wasn't on the list. So yeah. So we're missing two cast members next week.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Guess who's not here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What? That's terrible.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But given the circumstance, instead, we're going to have a non-numbered episode next week, instead it looks like we're going to throw in for a new, higher-level battle royale for those who will be here to see how some of these high-level abilities function.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You won't be there to put my face in lava this time! I'll just have myself to do that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know, you guys, I won't be there, so.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Will Friedle won the first one, she won the last one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've never done it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've never done it, either.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no. And you're doing it as Tary?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's up to you; you get to choose.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you going to bring back Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So if we loot Tary's body, do we get all of his stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not in canon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, even not in canon, in the game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, if you go to his body after he's dead, you can grab any of his shit to use it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You are a loot drop, oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As long as it's not attunement, you can use it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is the helmet attuned? It is, isn't it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe it is, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Probably, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Too bad. But we can just steal all of his jewels just for the sake of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. In the alternate universe version, you are just decked out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I get Doty in the fight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. That helps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you'll be leveled up to their level.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I'll be leveled up to their level?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the battle royale, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, we level up for that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway, that'll be next week. That pushes our hundredth episode to June 8th. And it looks like we're confirmed for June 1st for our next guest, I believe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we announcing that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, sure. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, well, yeah, on June 1st, our next guest, Jon Heder AKA Napoleon Dynamite, is going to come play with us and roll some dice. Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My mother has never been so proud of me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So, did we already say that because next week is a battle royale, that means our hundredth episode--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is pushed to the 8th, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, you already said that? Was I busy rolling dice and talking?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello and welcome back, everybody. So last time where we left off, Vox Machina, upon working on their bakery, the Slayer's Cake in Whitestone, made a possible new hire who turned out to be a drow bounty hunter named K'rynn, who was sent here to acquire Taryon Darrington and bring him back home to the city of Deastok In Wildmount. You guys all, through a series of high-level magic scrying and transportation, managed to cut off this specific bounty hunter on the outskirts of the city, and in doing so made an agreement to not slay her where she stood, and instead possibly make a transaction down the road. You guys then made your way into the city of Deastok to the Darrington Estate and were led up into the study of Howaardt Darrington, father of Taryon, in which you all discussed the reasons of why he was brought back, the current financial state of the family, and the intent to resolve and remedy long-standing sins of the father, through you standing up and doing your family duty, from his perspective. We left off as you guys had just finished that conversation. You've exited his study and were about to go about your business. Coming off the tension of the conversation, you closed behind you with a clack the heavy wooden doors of Howaardt's study. There you have Bertholt, who's standing off to the side, the dragonborn servant of the Darrington family, waiting patiently, and you all at this moment are at your own disposal. What do you wish to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just before we move: the names that Dad had told us about to maybe parlay with in the Myriad?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Korshad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Korshad?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Korshad, yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And how much was the debt? It was 260,000?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 230,000 gold debt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But wait, wasn't there some other name, the little--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Lydia!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lydia was who you are to be betrothed to, and the location was the Grumpy Lily.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was questioning myself, I was like there was no way something was called the Grumpy Lily.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grumpy Lily!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Many is who we want to speak to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just as something that happened, during that whole family conversation I was scanning the room and the bookshelves for anything interesting, anything out of sorts, anything out of place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a retroactive perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A retroactive perception check!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't want to-- yeah, I didn't see shit. I just rolled a three; that's nothing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rightly so!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Retrograde! You know they always say that retrograde perception is 20/20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I appreciate what you were going for there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Anyway, I would love to ask Bertholt if he knows the location of my sister.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, if you are looking for Maryanne, she's probably in her chambers."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, well, I mean I guess we can

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to go talk to her and touch base with her first? You can introduce us to her after.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. I'll lead them back downstairs to that main room that was all awful and terrible, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it was just dark and cold and empty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I'll lead them down there. This was our playroom, maybe you should just wait here and I'll go talk to sis. I'll be right back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there like furniture to sit on, or is it barren?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, no. There's furniture, and a lot of the furniture here is really well made, dark woods, fine deep red and maroon fabrics. A lot of it has dust on it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Plastic covers? No plastic covers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No plastic covers. But some of the furniture here is for use and some of it is here just as part of the decor, and it's very easy to see which ones are which.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm definitely going to sit on the ones that are just for decor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, they're really uncomfortable.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool. Going to rub my butt all over it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. At which point, Bertholt acknowledges that you guys will be staying. "Could I get anything for you? Perhaps teas, juice, water?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is this bullshit, no ale?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have fermented juice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll fetch the wine." And he hobbles off to acquire some means of imbibement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we pay him? We just found out he's dead fucking broke.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'd rather not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Most if it is, I wouldn't say a replica, but it very much resembles the decor and mood of your father's study. You see her currently sitting at a desk in the corner. Her blonde hair is tied back in a tied braid that runs down her back. She wears a coat and pants and seems to be dressed a little formally or businesslike for being casually at home. You haven't really seen her dress like this before, at least not in a casual circumstance. As you glance over past the doorway she looks up from her papers and goes, "Brother!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hello, sister.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "When have you arrived?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just today. Father kidnapped me and brought me home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Kidnapped?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Abducted. Abducted me and brought me home. Paid someone to do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Anyway, it's good to see you. Your room is coming along quite nicely. It seems like you're running the show now, is that true?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, not quite, but the responsibilities have definitely been mounting. You look well. How "have the wind-tossed roads of Exandria treated you this past year?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's been an interesting year abroad, and I would say I'm glad to be back, but for the abduction part and also the fact that I've now learned that we are destitute? Is that true?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We're on the path to destitution, yes."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So it's true; he wasn't just trying to guilt me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Probably both, to be honest. We're in a relatively dire situation compared to our previous "long-standing lifestyle choices. We're trying to fix this mess."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And what would have been your plan had I not arrived today?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you were part of the plan. We're trying to figure this out the best we can and "given the circumstances, we feel this is probably one of the most viable and least dangerous or risky "endeavors in which we can right the family's trajectory."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: By marrying me to some lady I've never met?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, you're welcome to meet her. I've met her. I helped to arrange this."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is she like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "She's very nice. She's very pretty, a bit bookish, which once again would befit you rather "well, but let's be honest. This is a political marriage. You do what you want. I mean, "there isn't a politician or a lord of this land that hasn't in some way, shape, or form made their "own life outside of the family." At that point, you noticed she gets a bit dark and seems to speak with this bit of sarcasm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And father's businesses, are they being run the same way? With the same attention to detail?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's been no necessary change to the way business has been done. Other than the transition "of some responsibilities, of course." And she gives a slight nod. She's getting a little uncomfortable as this conversation continues.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Listen, I'm sorry to pop in like this and challenge your judgment, but me marrying this person would solve our problems long-term? Somehow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Marrying into this family, the Truscan lot, would enable us the resources and connections to "reacquire the deeds to our land, to reacquire the business elements that we've been in this "unnecessary partnership with for some time, and would enable us to once again reclaim complete "rulership of our family-controlled lands."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we not own anything anymore?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is a partnership that is quickly sliding into the behest of the Myriad."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So what is ours now? Anything? Our personal belongings? This home?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Own solely on our own? Some of the furniture."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And again, if I do this, what's to say we're not just going to drive up another debt again? Doesn't seem like father or you have been very good at keeping us in the black.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have only been recently brought into this unfortunate circumstance, brother. And you can "trust in knowing that in my studies and my time spent here, working with father, being very clear, "and very thorough with the mistakes he's made in the past, "I will not be doomed to repeat them."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you and he are two peas in a pod, yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, he's certainly in need of retiring based on the stress he's put upon himself. It would "not be long until I will take over the responsibilities."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I may poke around and see if there's another way I could help. But before I do, is this fun for you? Do you like running this business, or almost running it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's certainly a better challenge than many other daughters of lords "are given in their time."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you have any friends?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Friends come, when the money and power's in place. You know this."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's the way the land works."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I'll leave you to your work, and-- love the decorations. I'm considering the offer and I'll have an answer for you by tomorrow morning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Consider the respect you have for the people who have worked their entire lives to provide for you "what you have been given. Mother and Father sacrificed so much for us. Consider weighing one's "selfish interest versus the importance of a bloodline. That is all I ask."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I'll consider it. With all my intellect.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A pat. The back pat. Good day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good day." She straightens her coat and sits back behind her desk and waits for you to leave.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I'll shimmy out. (sighs) All right, I'll rejoin my friends downstairs. Well--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How did it go?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, yourself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As expected. Things are about the same between me and Maryanne.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is she still a raging bitch?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, she's not raging.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I just think it's rather rude that she doesn't want to come down here and meet us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She has her work and her--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, she's not coming down?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's weird.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, I don't know, she's busy. I guess.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're not guest people. They're not dinner party family.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We picked up on that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not even for people who could help them with their name?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you mention us or anything else?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope. It didn't come up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did they have any idea what a heavy hitter you are now? The type of people you roll with?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They said, how have I been? But they don't really give a shit either way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you didn't even offer up the information?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If they are not interested in me, why should I be interested in them knowing about me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a very good point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's back it up. What are you thinking? Where's your head at? How can we help you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know what to do. There's this woman; she's apparently nice and I could go for it and marry her, and then it seems like all my family problems would be okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Forever?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's no such thing as family problems being okay for forever.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. I'm sort of curious about talking to the people who are in this contract with my father and seeing if there's any way to wiggle out of it a little bit, but I don't know how to solve everything right now. I also don't know-- I feel a duty, a responsibility to this family, because they are my family.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You feel a doodie? The privy is over there! Or over there! Or the front yard beckons.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He may have opened a bottle of wine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm lost for the rest of this conversation.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we're not drunk, we may have just had a little bit of wine, just a small amount.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I carved my name into the floor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Part of me wants to-- oh god. Part of me wants to turn around and go back with you to Whitestone and forget that the Darringtons exist, but I don't think I can't do that. I am a Darrington and I owe it at least to my name to try and fix what I can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's your plan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't sacrifice your entire life for this, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I'll try not to, but it seems like a plan B at this point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, you had no prior knowledge to your family's connection to the mob?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No? It's way cooler than I thought my family ever was. I knew my dad did shady business with lots of shady characters but I never knew-- I assumed he paid off people. I assumed he had friends in high places and people who you'd have to bribe to turn the other cheek, but I never knew that he was in business with them, owing our whole existence to these terrible people, and I don't know what to make of that

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: T, I think we're all prepared to help you do anything you want to do, but are you sure you want to help perpetuate the family business?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Grumpy Lily.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like the Laughing Ninny. I kinda want to go there instead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then there's a long-term problem which I'll have to solve on another day. There's a long- term problem that my family is awful and needs to be stopped at all costs, and that's something that I'll have to deal with tomorrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do the Truscans, that's who you are being married into potentially, do they have a son?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That doesn't help! That's almost beside the point!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're talking about marrying the sister? Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's still--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess it's not the same, is it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No! Actually, it's unfortunately the opposite.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're royalty. You know this!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course, I know everything about royalty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Little royal girl.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What exactly is your duty that you are feeling inclined towards? Damn it, Grog!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Lilah? Is it Lilah?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Lydia.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perhaps we should talk to this Lydia as well, because she is obviously in a position of being told what she is going to do with herself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! Maybe she's also a badass!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: At the very least, we should meet all the chess pieces on the board, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, she lives in another part of the kingdom, right, Matthew Mercer?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not a problem.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yes, that's true. But there's the in-town people we can meet first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure. Let's talk to the mob!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, of course! You'll come with me? Because I can't talk to the mob by myself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tary, of course we will!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, when you said we need to stop your family at all costs, are you talking about killing them?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I'm not talking about killing them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, but Grog does bring up a point that I was trying to make before he started laughing when I said "duty." (giggles) But what, are you committed to keeping your family around? You said you were compelled and you felt like you had a duty but then you immediately started talking about--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stop it, Travis! God, I can't--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tearing your family apart? And stopping them?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My family is pretty bad, I've learned. But I've also learned from young Trickfoot that even a rotten family is worth trying to save. And I admire the path that she took with her family, and I would like to at least try to push mine in the right direction and try to make our name a little less shitty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a pretty big matzo ball, my friend.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that's why that's long term. In the short term, I just want to get them safe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If there's one thing I understand, it's giving your life to a cause.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't want to die, if that's what you're saying.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dedicating.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dedicating.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Time is a gift, I would say.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So dedicating that gift is, it's a big thing, but I hope you believe in it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't believe in them, but I believe in the cause right now, and we'll see how far that takes us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We believe in you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can you describe to me this duty?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You don't care!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think I do now. Is it real hard?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a little more nebulous than that, Grog.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can pass on this for now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Adjectives are not my strong suit, so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know what an adjective is! That's impressive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It just itched everywhere.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Listen. When you see my duty, you'll know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Copy that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's loose. This duty is loose.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we go to the Grumpy Lily, then?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is going so well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're exiting the house and Berthold's opening the door, you hear some heavy creaking from the stair that leads down to the main area, and you watch as an older woman in her early fifties or so with her mid-length, curly brown hair in shades of gray, green eyes behind a small set of reading spectacles, stoic of face, wearing what looks to be some sort of a finely crafted silk robe, clutching a book under her arm, comes down the steps and looks down and goes, "Taryon?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mama?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Taryon, my boy!" And she sets the book down and walks up, puts her hands out as she says, "Oh," takes you at the sides of the face and pulls you in for (kisses). "Oh, terribly sorry. I "didn't realize that we had guests."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is the team known as Vox Machina. They are a fearless band of adventurers and they have taken me in as their own.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Look at you, so rugged!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well. Yes, I am, a bit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So you've had some adventures with my boy, have you?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: We have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's wonderful. Have you spoken with your father?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I've spoken to Father, and Sister, and it's good to know they're healthy. And it's lovely to see you, as well. Have you been happy at all, this last year?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I--" And she reaches back and takes the book off the step and goes, "I've been making my "way through your library."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Oh, my books, in my room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes! Well, I've had a lot of time to myself. Been a bit under the weather for some "time, and these have kept me fine company."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. That's lovely. I hope you've enjoyed them as much as I did. What's your favorite one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, not this piece of trash." And she sets it down. "There's one. What was it called? "The River's Dawn. It was a brilliant--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before the River's Dawn, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was very, very beautiful!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, yes! No it was, but also heartbreaking at the same time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very much so. It reminded me of you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. That's one of my favorites, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well. I didn't break the binding too much, I hope."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll fix it if you did. It's all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that's wonderful to hear. I'm glad you've been entertaining yourself. I know living with Papa can be very hard, and it's been very hard on you all these years.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you would excuse us for just a moment, please. Just a few moments." And she points towards the door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I told you they were like this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Front yard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bottle of wine!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Berthold is leading you out of the main area, out the front door.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, front door!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Out the house, like get out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys were on your way out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just wait on the fucking porch!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We got it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I know not."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, you're right to think this way. This year has been eye-opening for me, and I know that you care for Papa, and you are a diligent and faithful wife. But I know how hard it must have been to live this life for so many years and I wonder what it would be like if you hadn't been with him, what kind of person you would be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Looking at you, looking at your sister, I wouldn't change it for the world."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, things are going to have to change at some point, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "One way or another. I just-- (sighs) I just want you to make choices for yourself. I want you "to do what you think is right, that you could live with. Duty and blood is one thing, but... Anyway, "I'm talking out of turn."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. Thank you. Thank you for that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Could you not tell Howaardt we've had this conversation?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mum's the word. All right. I'll be back, and maybe we'll have time to talk more books later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would like that very much."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good evening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good evening." As you leave, she's like, "Oh! The other one I was trying to remember was "The Mountain Range of Gold. It was a wonderful three-part series--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When you think he's dead, but he's not, and he comes back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, the second book, you get halfway through it before he even turns "and reveals himself!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know! Well, you never see the body in the first one, so that should have been a tip-off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And then the white robes and everything! His renewed power, it's incredible! Anyway, I'm "sorry, you have your friends waiting on you. Good night, Taryon."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to adopt her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's awesome!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you step out to greet the rest of your friends?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's go to the Jumping Jimmy, or whatever it's called.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How's your mother?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was the longest conversation I've had with her in many years.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: She said she's under the weather. What's wrong?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It took me spreading my wings and flying before I found my sense of humor. My hair looks better, my eyes look better.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought you said that was because of the aloe vera.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, yes. We didn't have any at home.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, yeah. Salt air is better for you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, life needs aloe to live. Is something I always say.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've heard you say that two or three times.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Moisturizing products in general. Life needs moisturizing products to live.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Life needs moisture to live.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know my beauty regimen's changed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Life needs moisture to live. It's way smarter-sounding.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, gauntlet dropped.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, to the Laughing Ninny it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Who's leading this charge? Probably you, Taryon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know the place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are in charge while we're here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, you find your way fairly far north into the city until you come across the exterior of the Grumpy Lily. Asking a few questions to guide you to which building it is, it's much smaller than you expected. You see what appears to be a single-story pub with one window, one door, no more than maybe 30 feet on any given side. It is lit from the inside, though it's dimly lit. As you approach and push past the somewhat ajar entryway, you see before you what appears to be three tables. Three singular, stained, brown tables. One lone patron sits at the center table, an elderly man inspecting a small, clay sculpture that he's enraptured by, and a single barkeep to your right that seems to notice your entry. A healthy, pale woman of brunette hair in her forties, dressed in a simple gray blouse. As soon as you enter and take in the atmosphere, she goes, "Slow day, folks! Happy to have the business! "What can I get you?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jeez, Grog, I don't even know if you're going to fit in here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's really tiny.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your head does reach the ceiling.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just dive in then?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we get anything to drink first? Or just dive in?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's like how you have to buy something to use the restroom.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have a shiraz? I was just wondering if you had any imports. Do you have a red wine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes! That I can get for you, dear. Don't worry. Red wine we can do definitely." She walks over and slams her hand on the side of the bar and what you thought was once the patron now appears to be the one barman there. "Wait! What! Oh. I missed the conversation."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh the guy with the sculpture?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, sit down, find a place wherever you like."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Put two tables together, I guess?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All three, really.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's just take them all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, this is the meeting place of a dark group, right? A shady group? Shouldn't we check this area for anything shady?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there shade in this establishment?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's dimly lit, so there's plenty of shadows.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a five-by-five square. Do we see anything amiss? Oh, that's terrible. 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing seems amiss. It seems like a shitty pub. It's the definition of a poorly attended dive.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like there's any seams in the ground that would be a trapdoor or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can make an investigation check if you want to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to look around the floor and keep perspective around the area. No. You see some stains, you see some crumbs, and at one point you look over in the corner and you see what appears to be a piece of stale bread that's been left under one of the tables and there are three rats currently eating it. As soon as you lean in, they all stop and look at you and scatter.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you can keep going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Could be worse. They could not be afraid of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) They just give you the fuck-you look and keep eating their bread.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's when you know you've really found the right bar. The rats were like: "We reserved "this table two weeks ago. You have to make a phone call."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (grunts, clinks) "I'll get your cups." Turns around and starts shuffling back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughing) Do you need any help?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean we have-- Oh, it's fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just let it happen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Who do you think we proposition here? The old man?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That guy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That guy? Really? What makes you say that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Shifty eyes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shifty yeah, may be an act, even.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's just old I thought. No?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nobody's just old.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's many things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true, look at Pike's grandpa.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Look at Pike.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Look at me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How old are you, again?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I said goddamn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that true?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Well, because you could be.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I forgot my birthday. I don't know how old I am.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it in the hundreds?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No. I think it's in the 30s.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whatever you want.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You ain't no baby.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gentleman shuffles back now with a bunch of cups. His hands wrung through all the various handles. (grunts, clicks)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Impressive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (grunts) "Two gold for both bottles."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I give him two gold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In my earring, I say to Vex: I'm clamming up, you do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sir?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see him walking and he goes like (sighs).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: On your way to the back, could you tell the Many we'd like to speak to them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He slowly turns his head over to the bartender, the woman. "What was that?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, just a conversation with the Many.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What about them?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I dip my thumb into some wine and I use thieves' cant and write "discuss" in wine on the bar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (click) She gives a click noise to the old man, who goes (groan, thump) Are you going to take your bottles or what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, yeah, we'll definitely keep those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, pick them up. Follow me."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, we're going to get to see the real bar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're like, just go fucking faster! His pace is terrible. Yeah, it's awful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Running ahead, turning around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly, just waiting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Over here, adventurer!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, he takes you out of the small pub, past the unused kitchen, which has another series of stale bread clumps on the side, down to what looks to be a broom closet. He gets there to the edge of the broom closet and pulls out a key ring.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to pay attention to what key he's taking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I take the bread crumbs from the corner and throw it down so the rats could have it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They scatter a little further out. You turn around and the minute you turn, in the air you hear (skittering) and look over, and there's like seven rats that just scurried out of the shadows and are just going at these crumbs immediately.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I kill all of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sploosh!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I nudge my sister and say, all mine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. That she is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He pulls one key and unlocks the small closet. You paid attention? (creak) Opens this rickety wooden door, and goes (grunt) and walks past, and he's behind the door, expectantly waiting. You guys glance into the space, and you can see there's what looks to be a low torchlight about every ten feet down a wooden stairway that descends about 30, 40 feet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Traps, people hiding, anything that seems out of place or dangerous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Traps, or people hiding?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Traps.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll look for people hiding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check, investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA, ASHLEY
lines.text: Twinsies!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Look at that. That's disgusting. All right, so you guys make your way down. No traps in the stair descent, but you make your way to the bottom of the stairs without issue. You don't see anything necessarily fishy. You do see these torches have been burning for a little bit, a couple hours, and are probably needing to be re-upped pretty soon. You guys eventually make your way down, and as soon as the last of you-- who's following up the rear in this, by the way? What's the marching order?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go toward the front with the twins?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The hallway here is about big enough for you to go single file.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. You'll hang behind me, Tary?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm in front of Grog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'll hang with Grog and Pike.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm in the center, as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm in the back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so Grog's in the very back. Keyleth, Percy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike is with Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Pike's with Grog. So we'll say, Grog in the back, then Pike, then Keyleth, then Percy, then Taryon?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Vex and Vax. And you have Trinket in your necklace, I assume? Okay. All right, so you guys descend down the stairway. As soon as, Grog, you make your way in, it's tiny. You have to (straining) squeeze in and duck low and even just walking through the pathway, your shoulders are rubbing against the sides of the wall, and your head occasionally (bang, bang).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's like you in Japan, baby!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just turning around, I was like (crash).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The beds, was that like lying down on a saltine for you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah. My heels were just over like the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We went into McDonald's and his head hit the ceiling!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are a kaiju!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: A kaiju from the deep! A level seven!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, wait, before we go any further.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god. Holy shit. Before we go any further, wait.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I have to be doing a short rest to do the Inspiring Leader thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's ten minutes, it takes to do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, never mind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, no, we could stand here for ten minutes!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no, please. Fucking say some words!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm new to the being an inspiring leader thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's ten minutes, before you know you're going to go into something, you stop and do this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I should've done that at the bar.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wouldn't that be cool if you were just pep-talking us all the way down here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Start it now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, start it now! Just do it while we're walking!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, okay. As we walk I'll be like: You know what, guys? I've had a lot of time to think over the year that we've been away--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door closes behind Grog and you hear it lock.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I feel like we've grown so much as people, and you guys are family. You're a family to me. And I go on for a while. Do you guys remember that time in Stillben? When we very first met, and we all didn't really like each other, and Grog, I don't think you understood me for a while.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Still don't.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's fine. That's fair. Hey Grog, do you remember that one time--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is great, by the way, because at the bottom of the stairs it only goes for about 15 more feet before there's a door. There's a man on a stool who's just sitting there going--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She'll just be another minute.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm about to find out what the inside of a Bag of Holding feels like, I swear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's not stopping you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you remember that time-- I think it was the first time I made you laugh, and I turned into an earth elemental, and then pretended to do an "I'm going down the stairs" thing through the floor?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I just remembered that the other day, and I just love you guys so much, you know?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't feel included in this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But I love you so much!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, now I feel better. That's all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Any change in our bodies or anything?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's going for ten in-game, real-time minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are all in the hallway, Grog at the back, you can't move forward, because everyone's stopped, and you're just like-- (groan) All of you who wish to can take 17 temporary hit points. That's by the inspiring leader feat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah, you want to mock until you realize you get your hit points!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is your choice as to whether or not you felt inspired by that and take them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I love you guys. I love you guys so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog's too uncomfortable to take them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I just start weeping silently in the back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, let's be honest, he wouldn't even feel the difference.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true, yeah. That's what Grog needs, is temporary hit points.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog would just go (sneezes).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not showing your sensitivity?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was a nice trip down memory lane.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel inspired.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, hey! How's it going there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see this guy, he's tough and surly, looks like a balding man who's just like made of muscle and anger. He's sitting there with one eye open, one a little squinted, he's just--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you feel inspired? No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not the warm and fuzzy type, are you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He doesn't seem to respond. You do hear like a series of muffled voices and what sounds like a faint beat of some kind from the other side of the wall, just muffled.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is the password, "I am what I am," not sure? Too strange a reference; never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He begins to reach over for what looks to be a small lever that's hidden on the side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're here to speak to the Many.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stops. (grunts)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to just go on in, then.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That word just gets us in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has almost a weird--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Would you say more like Blue Man Group or more like a subway bucket drummer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Take a little Blue Man Group and a little bit of subway bucket drummer. It's right in between there. You guys step into the chamber and take in the atmosphere a bit. Whether that be with smiles, awe, or confusion and care.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's exactly what I said, the real bar.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I like this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is like old times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Welcome to our little slice of the family. What can I get you?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we brought bottles. That's rude, isn't it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The good stuff is down here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We'll get you right fucked up, eh?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have a shiraz?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll see what I can muster."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like these people!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Slim pickings for room here. It's a bit early in the evening. That's when it's the "busiest. Just find some space, sit down. Folks don't want you to sit by them? "Don't fucking sit by them."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you. Do we see room for a large group?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see two tables that have room for half of a large group.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. Split up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't we ask them nicely if they would like to move?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, let's not do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no. You do that. Go by yourself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. This is special.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about the talkers go to one table?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then the defenders go to another in case shit goes bad. I like that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Defenders' Table. Yeah, so I'm going to the talkers' table.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, obviously.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vex, Tary, I feel like you guys are good talkers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll join you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm actually going to wander the room.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll sit with Grog and Pike.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, Shiraz time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's our play here? Do we just keep saying the word "many" as many times as we can and see how far it goes?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is about as in as we get with the Many.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is it? So now we ask for her by name? Or him by name? Korshad?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. He or she may not reveal themselves too quickly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could buy Korshad a drink.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is a beautiful idea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Care of one Taryon Darrington.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course. I have just enough for a nice drink.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, we'll cover the drink, darling. Party funds cover the drink. It's just in your name.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Oh, okay. All right. All right. I'm slow to catch on sometimes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we grab a barmaid?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You split between the two tables. One of the tables appears to be three guys who are in a card game. As soon as you sit down they (grunts) and then keep talking amongst themselves more about taking bets, bluffing each other, giving shit about their home lives, stuff like that. The other table has four quiet individuals that are, look to be elvish lineage. Either half-elf or full elf; it's hard to tell. They're wearing these hoods that show the ears from underneath but then seem to block a lot of the features of their face and guard a lot of the forehead. This silk hood that drips down past the nose on the sides.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we recognize any semblance of that garb?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a history check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: History check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, my history is shit, but 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. You haven't seen this kind of dress, but you've heard of it. It seems to be of Wildmount but the eastern side of Wildmount, not a part of the Dwendalian Empire. This more stems from Zorhaus, which is the other kingdom on the continent. It's actually in a tense existence along the border of the Dwendalian Empire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You said it was to the east?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Zorhaus, I'm pretty sure that's what it's called.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is! It's whatever it's called in the campaign guide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Oh man, that's right. Now you have to stick to what you wrote. That's crazy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But anyway. As soon as you sit down at the table the four individuals look at each other and then get up from the table and then walk off to find another place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I smell amazing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I smell fucking fantastic, and I'm over there. I am going to laze about the musicians and listen to the musicians and wait for them to finish a set.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess all of us can sit at the table because of the people--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you sit around the table, the barhand that met you here approaches and once more goes, "All right, looks like you've found a place to sit, "what can I get you? Got you that shiraz you were asking for, eh." He goes ahead and he pulls up what looks to be a dark green bottle, already uncorked and he brings over a hefty metallic goblet or tankard and then pours it in there. It appears to be something akin to a shiraz, I suppose. Fills it to the top, slides it forward. "All right. Drinks for anyone else, eh?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you got any pies or meat or both?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To drink.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do they not have food?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, probably.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can get you a meat pie, if that's what you're asking. I don't recommend you drink it, "though you could probably squeeze water from a stone, so wouldn't surprise me if you could."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, meat pie and an ale, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, coming on up. Anyone else?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whiskey?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Same.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It can be done. So whiskey. And you, little one?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, you said you have things that will fuck you up right, so what would that be considered?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I mean no offense, lady, but you're a bit small-sized--"

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean that respectfully! Look, I'm just looking out for my patrons here. I don't want to "go ahead and send someone to the local temple."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She can drink most people under the table.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Bring it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. I'll take your word for it, then."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll have another shiraz.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Another shiraz."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Over the earring: Pickle, will you get me one of those, as well, and don't drink it before I come back?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: As a matter of fact, I want two of whatever that is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, coming up." And he leaves the table.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did you order the drink for when he comes back?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I'll slip him a gold piece.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I thought you were about to shake his hand with two fingers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There is a coin between the two fingers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Korshad, you say?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I nudge him under the table.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You want what he likes, it's going to cost you more than that."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does he like?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whatever it is, here is another four and keep another one for yourself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you very much. That'll put you up to yours, though. We will go ahead and settle your "bills at the end of the drinks. But all right, Korshad it is."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What table did the bartender look at when he said that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I was planning on totally watching that, too.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that's a safe 13.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I roll, too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you said you were looking, too, so roll a perception, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well yeah, okay. 30.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30, okay. You gather the direction that he glanced. It was a cursory look, more to see if the individual in question was still in the room or not. But you got the direction of it, and you know exactly where he was looking-- three tables and that way there. He leaves for a bit, and the laughter is still rising and falling throughout the room. The musicians in the corner, which are two younger human boys and what appears to be a female goliath, who has the heavier drum in the center, who is like the mid-piece, the big (heavy drum noises). The two guys, one of them has a small set of lap drums, (light drum noises) the faster beats. And the guy to the left of her-- they could be brothers; you're not too sure, their features are similar but different enough, the ages seem off. The guy on the left has a series of small wooden blocks and what looks to be some sort of contraption that has three or four different small percussion instruments that are all fixed to it and so he is leaping between them all. For being just percussion, that variety is still making a cool melody. You're still able to find certain notes and certain blends where it still is a very different and unique atmosphere. They manage to bring to this crescendo the piece that you entered on, and it finishes. There is no real-- there is occasionally a couple of claps here and most everyone is busy about their own shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, I clap. Excuse me, players?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As they're both looking over to grab a drink to stop and the younger guy with a scruffy chin and this mop of hair that's a little wild glances over to you: "Yeah?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was a really unique piece you guys just did there. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're welcome."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, I have only ever heard music like that one time, and it wasn't here. It wasn't in this city, it was actually in Emon. What was his name? Dranzel. It was a musician named Dranzel-- this is a long shot, but you haven't come across a Dr. Dranzel in your travels? I've always wanted to hear him play again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Can't say I have, sir. My apologies."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry. You guys ever heard of Dr. Dranzel?" And the other guy goes, "Nope."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Orcish. Stylish hats.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry, friend."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm keeping an eye on the side of the room that he glanced in, looking for anybody going and delivering drinks to the people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You watch the gentleman who has been getting you guys drinks, and he is in the process of getting all of your various drink orders and pouring what you have requested, and he does come to a point where he gets this one fine jewel goblet that he has specifically set off to the side and he takes it and washes it and takes care to clean it entirely and dry it off, and once it's set there he reaches underneath, counting a few bottles and pulls one drink, uncorks it and there is this thick dark brown glass jug and as he uncorks it he pours it into there, glances over, grabs another thing, seems to be mixing it with something else. He is being very careful with the actual amounts he is pouring. He finishes that, takes a piece of what looks like an orange, crushes it in the inside and leaves the rind and takes it and swishes it for a second. (sighs) And walks over to a table across the entire hall, where you saw him glance before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One sex on the beach! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are very familiar with caste systems that have emerged in a lot of these central metropolitan areas, and so you can very easily pick up some of those themes. Two of them appear as a contrast very simply dressed. No jewelry. You can't make out any details in this distance and there is one man who he hands the drink to, he sets it down in front of him and slides it forward. The man you see there, he has deep brown skin, marked, there appear to be a number of tattoos that curl up his arms and up the side of his neck and touch his ears on each side. He's wearing light, billowing clothes of silver and maroon silks that end about the elbow and are just hanging beneath, leaving the rest of his arm completely visible where you can see the tattoo continues up the forearm and grasps the back of the hand, almost like he has a gauntlet on that is just his skin. You see around him a series of gold and silver bracelets and rings that adorn his fingers. His face is framed by a lion's mane of black and gray dreadlocked hair. Because of your perception check, at this distance and your ranger-like eyes, you can see what you perceive to be a visible scar on his throat from ear to ear. He's currently mid-conversation with the patrons at the table, leaned back in his chair in a comfortable setting and as soon as the drink-- huh?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I read his lips?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're simple ceramic mugs that are dark and handcrafted, and he sloshes them up to you and as you see inside, most ale has a good liquidy content. This has a very syrupy thick texture to it. He slides both forward and goes, "I don't expect you to drink both those back to back."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, that's not up for you to decide, my friend. I get on my earring. Hey, String Bean, your drink is here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and Sarenrae will know if you drink it before I get back, so just hold onto it for me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, I can't make any promises.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You sip this, slowly."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Change-Bringer's Nectar?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Write that shit down. Can Keyleth get up and walk past the diplomats' table and run my hands--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you guys are all at the same table now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, we're at the same table now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, one table got up as soon as you sat down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, so we scootched together? Okay, then I'm just going to lean into Vex and give her an Enhance Ability on her charisma.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh! I'll take that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You get advantage--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: On charisma checks?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. On checks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Her cleavage gets a little nicer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It can't get any nicer than it already is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very fair.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All said out loud.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pike, which one of those two is Vax's? Which one of those two belongs to Vax?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh that one? I'm taking a sip of it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Take a sip. It's very thick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's very thick, and it's sweeter than you expected, but it has a definite burn that grows and grows after drinking it. It's syrupy, but because of its syrupy texture, as it goes down it also coats and numbs everything as it touches.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percy, I saw that. You have to buy me a whole other drink.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fine. I put my whiskey in its place and take the whole cup.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No motherfucker, that's not what I said! I want to drink that one and the one after it! Oh, you don't want to start with me, Fredrickstein.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you sipping it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm sipping it. I'm doing as the locals do. Enjoying it how he told me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you get the sense it's probably a good thing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It burns!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's almost like maple syrup Everclear.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ugh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gross!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How's my meat pie?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Meat pie's pretty good!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is pretty good!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That makes me want an empanada right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Role-playing, guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sadly, no empanadas in Deastok.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why isn't he coming over here? Should we send another drink? Maybe two this time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's in the middle of a conversation right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He has to sit and enjoy his drink.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let him take some time.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (slurring words) Should we sent him a Change-Bringer's Nectar? Oh no!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, Pike!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (still slurring) I only had like three drinks. Three sips.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keep going.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just tiny sips.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They were so small.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Drink some, maybe some water, too, in between each sip.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Maybe some meat pie.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's whiskey. That's supposed to be-- never mind. Go ahead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a check to see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a religion check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aw, I'm not good at this. Pike, you know gods!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let me see if I know. Will I know the Change-Bringer?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, please. I have no idea. I definitely have zero idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's really not that hard. The Change-Bringer is Avandra. Avandra, one of the gods of the pantheon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. Yeah, of course we knew that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Change-Bringer is the deity that looks over luck, looks over adventure, travel, the open road. That's as much as you can glean from your passing knowledge of the deity. Since you are not a woman of faith, obviously, you don't know much beyond that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It just sounded fancy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It sounded so fancy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's also known as "she who makes the path."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, Tary.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes? Is it time? Should I go over there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stop being so weird.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you want a sip of Change-Bringer's Nectar?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It might actually help you just a little bit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sit down, pay attention, and do everything she says.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And don't look sneaky.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Have a sip of this. It'll help.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, seriously. Just have a little sip. A little sip, it's always good to relax your nerves.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Loosey-goosey.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take my helm and cock it to the side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, jauntily. That's good, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, now I feel like I'm on a listing ship.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's your confident face look like? More tongue. Little further. Yep. Little higher eyebrow on the right side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, maybe stop. I'm just afraid he's going to look over here at any moment. I'm keeping an eye on good old Korshad, and seeing if he looks over here. I also want to see if I can catch his lips and see what he's talking about over on the side there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I would like to look around the room and make sure that other people aren't watching us, or if so, where in the bar they are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I would like to make my way over to the goliath woman.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So as you begin walking in that direction, Vex. Couple things. One, you notice that Korshad, while he seems to be mostly being talked at or at least just listening to a conversation, when he does speak, he leans in and does this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course he fucking does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense he's a very guarded man and this is not his first rodeo. He speaks through his fingers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do, too!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But he doesn't appear to look over at your table again. He seems to have acknowledged the drink, is enjoying it slowly, and is back enthralled by the conversation at his table. What did you roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. And what did you say you were going to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mimic Vex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You both cover your mouths.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm following your lead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't have to do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does this one still work? We can do this one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that one's good. Just this.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is this good?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's it, Pike. Pike's got it. He's definitely going to come over and talk to us now, I can feel it. We're so cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a lot of drink that I seem to have taken on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax. Glancing about the chamber, remember I said there was a secondary platform, that didn't have any doorways to rooms, but there was just the upper walkway across the room both ways? There are about six figures on each one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Six on each one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're all sitting there, wearing leather armor, mostly covered by a cloak. You glance up and you can see underneath at least two of the cloaks what appear to be the shape or outline of a crossbow at the ready.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 12 of them? 12 men?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 12 or so above us all, so no sudden movements.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't notice this, because you really don't care, but anybody who had musical interests would be able to pick up on this. But you walk up and you see the goliath woman. Most of the goliath women you've come across, their lifestyle leads to either very short-kept or very tightly bound hair, as the coarse hair of the goliaths tends to mat up very thickly when living in the wild as your tribe did. This goliath female's hair is really well kept, actually. It's almost shining, which catches you off guard entirely. She's not tattooed and appears to be in a trance as she's in the process of drumming away, not even looking at the two of her compatriots or any patron. She's spacing out and is currently enraptured by the music she's creating.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any weapons around her feet or where she's sitting or playing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She has very nice boots. And as a man who has made boots in the past, you can acknowledge, those are very well-made boots.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Me Grog!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just love the alacrity that Travis goes to two, three. It's so good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You play good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The head slowly turns and the eyes focus for a second in the dim, snow-blind looking pupils, and gives you a nod.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice hair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Head turns a little to the side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll be-- if you--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Tell her she has nice boots, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Tell her she has nice boots.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice boobs!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (bang) Big drum hit, and her part of the song comes to a halt. The two other bits of music alter but continue the beats, and she just--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Boots. Nice boots. Bidet. And I go back to the group.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you walk back to the group, a little dejected, Vax, since you're the one who's paying attention the most at this point, you notice as the goliath gets this small grin on the side of her face and continues to go back to the drums.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You charmed her!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look at you!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nice work, de Bergerac!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But Grog doesn't see it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll be your Cyrano!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So what's the next order of business, guys?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that conversation breaking up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's what I planned on doing, is waiting out that conversation. I in no way want to interrupt it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 20 additional minutes go by. Another round is bought at the table, with Korshad still slowly, very carefully sipping the drink that you guys bought for him. Doesn't appear to be slowing, doesn't appear to be breaking. You can keep waiting if you want.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to get one of those fancy drinks for myself and see what it is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You mean the Korshad drink?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want one of the Korshad drinks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of the Korshad drinks, okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would assume you've already had this stuff at this point. We've been sharing a cup around. This is too much for a human being to handle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you go to the bar?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll go up to the bar. We don't know his name, do we? The bartender's name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hey, do you need something?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course, darling. I didn't catch your name.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh! Wence."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wence, thank you so much. Could I grab another of those fabulous five-gold drinks there, that you brought to our friend?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, you want Schlond's Embrace. Okay. If you're sure about that."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know, what is it?

lines.name: MATT
