lines.text: Protection from acid would probably be very--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, but my Wind Walk-- I already Wind Walked, so I can do a Heroes' Feast at a higher level. I also want to do a 5th-level Commune with Nature.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. 5th-level Commune with Nature.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What should I ask? What should I ask that we don't already know?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, is there any nature down there? It's a mine. It's all rocks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I can see in a two-, three-mile radius.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How deep does the hole go?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was thinking that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Instantly gain knowledge of up to three facts of your choice about any of the following subjects as they relate to the area: terrain; bodies of water; prevalent plants, minerals, animals, or peoples; powerful celestials, fey, fiends, elementals, or undead; influence from other planes of existence; or buildings.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Choose three of those.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: First and foremost, influences from other planes of existence.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as you focus and Commune with Nature, the plants speak to you in this series of images and thoughts that essentially get the idea across to you that there is something planar involved here, but it's very old and long-dormant, recently awoken.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Planar, long dormant.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Recently awoken.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If it's a fucking baby ancient dragon I'm going to be stoked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so something planar.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Didn't Drez Vina send us to a fetal thing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that was our first fight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, we can't do how deep is the mine? No?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I can, it's a terrain question, so terrain. Yeah. How deep does this mine go?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you can ask where the thing is in the mine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is. I think I can, right? Can I sense the location of where--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can ask whereabouts this thing is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nature tells you this sinkhole goes down for about a quarter-mile, and it lies at the very bottom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's just straight down at the bottom of it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's 400 meters, y'all.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So it's like this and then the little baby thing at the bottom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Apparently, yeah. The whole ground just collapsed inward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 400 meters and the entity lies at the bottom.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can just jump. We're like gods.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we're gods!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're golden gods.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's only a little bit more than 1000 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, then you might survive that one? Only if you turn into a goldfish and fall onto the ground. It's fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Now I know Looney Tune physics doesn't work in this world.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Always go earth elemental.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Always Keyteor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So what's our last question?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Something from another plane. We know it's 400 meters down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It lies at the bottom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How many of these creatures are there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Of the crawly ones?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ankhegs. Can I get a sense of how many and whereabouts the ankhegs are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of the two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are ankhegs? Are they fiends?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're beasts, probably. They're big bugs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aberrations?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, because if there's hundreds, then--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a problem.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then this is a stealth mission.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are monstrosities, and that's what they look like right there.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I love Starship Troopers. I'm excited.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're about to fight some big, armored vaginas.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: About how many? Do I know about how many there are? Sensing their skittering movements under the surface.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Using the nature's essence to let you know: somewhere in the neighborhood of about close to a hundred. Throughout the network of caves--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because this is a three-mile radius, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so this is spread out amongst what would essentially be a subterranean anthill of these ankhegs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's a lot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to need a fast exit. He wants us to take care of what the problem was.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've just got to kill the big boss. One little baby big boss. The boss baby.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did we understand correctly that it's the baby that cried out is the big monster? The big boss?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It seems to be the source of where all this started.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. And that's the thing that woke up the skitterers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or at least brought them to start attacking the surface.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I just wanted to make sure it wasn't like, there's a big boss and then there's skitterers and then there's also little babies that cry out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know. This is all the information you have.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But do we know why the baby woke up? What woke the baby?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we don't know what woke up the baby.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We didn't ask that? Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should talk to another dead person.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nah.

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think they'll know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're not miners.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They did something in the mine that awoke it. And we can redo it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think anybody who was there who saw it probably died at the center of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, we're trying to remember the very first game of D&D we ever played and Keyleth, twins, Grog were there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that's right. That was what was essentially a dead or stillborn deity. A demigod, essentially, in its own pocket plane.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So does it have anything to do with this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a religion check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. I'm bad at this! (groans)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm religious!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, if you want to, whoever's having this conversation you can make a religion check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Luck of the day. Yes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you serious?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I haven't rolled. I'm trying to make myself roll it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I got a 19.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Oh my god I rolled a natural 20!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shut up!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She really did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's like

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You recall a while back that you battled with that entity, you-- what was it called? Crysa-Thul.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not by the descriptor you've heard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Corpse called it a small one, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It called it a small one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're good. We've still got to camp for the night, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. We're camping. But we should camp in the trees, y'all. Not in the ground, in case the things come up out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the thick forest of Herethis surrounds the mine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh man.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I Druidcraft some web hammocks?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean you can, I mean we've gone to all this trouble, but if we want to add to it. I mean, this is just what we've been doing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look, I really like elaborate tree houses.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I understand. I respect the art form.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can have a rope bridge here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hammock bed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a cantrip, yo!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll pass. We'll just sleep with the ones we have or whatever

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A third-grade diorama.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. This is what it would look like if you were to build to scale. Okay. So you guys find a place in the trees? Who's helming finding that spot? All right. Go ahead and roll an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh wait! I honestly don't know anymore what my favored terrain does for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, this is exactly where to use it because forest is your favored terrain. This is exactly the kind of thing it would help with.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What am I rolling? Investigation?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. You find one massive tree. The trees here can get pretty big, and there's one thick tree that the branches are pretty easy to climb, and up top it branches out and all the various branches that make up the canopy. It's almost like this little bowl at the very top, just underneath where the heavy foliage descends, and it's a perfect place for you guys to make a camp higher up off the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, this is a place! Let's do it here!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll unload everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you guys make camp. Who's making first watch?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Me!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Me, too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh! Heroes' Feast.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Heroes' Feast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. We'll say as a note, this the last of the chalices you have prepared. If you want to do any more Heroes' Feasts, you'll have to specifically go and purchase the chalices or go look for it in town.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's do it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is this including or not including the chalice that Grog gave to Vex earlier to drink out of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That chalice, while it looks quite delightful, is not worth a thousand gold pieces.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's from Medieval Times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) It's a little gaudy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's got Michael's. Michael's crafts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, every time you drink from it you get glitter on your hands and you're like, shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How do you turn it off? Cover it in blankets.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay, Heroes' Feast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're immune to fear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're immune to fear, immune to poison, and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Advantage on wisdom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Marisha, you want to go ahead and roll the additional hit points for Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah 2d10, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 2d10, I believe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're losing our 17?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Lose our 17 from the speech?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's why I didn't take them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (gasps) Ooh! Wait, yeah! Ooh, that's amazing! It's a nine and a ten!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 19 additional hit points to all of you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you give us a speech, how long does that last?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me double check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But this is going to be a long rest?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh wait, but does that mean we lose our temporary hit points on the Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Temporary hit points are different. Technically, those two stack. You're about to lose the temporary hit points.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But then at the top of the morning, I can give us another speech.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Should you be so inclined, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I have to do it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, you don't. You don't.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck you, Travis. Fuck you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can give the essence of a speech.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, I can do an interpretive dance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's better.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Only if you actually do the interpretive dance.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, 19 extra?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's giving you a look.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A laser light show. With fireflies. It's like in a Disney Imagineer show.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a speech.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, well, it's a speech.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can give the essence of it, but the idea here is just you honing your public speaking skills.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're going to get better at it, Keyleth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's like public debate in high school.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Toastmasters.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I love Toastmasters.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Temporary hit points. They last until they're depleted or you finish a long rest. Yes, I was correct. Cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So in the top of the morning.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Top o' the mornin'!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. We'll say for the purpose of brevity, because even at your guys' level if you did encounter anything in this forest that was indigenous, you'd splatter it in a round. But you don't have any issues. Nothing really sees you up in the branches. You occasionally get caught off guard by the sound of a nearby (hooting). It's an owl in the trees. But nothing seems to bother you during your evening slumber. You complete your long rest. You still maintain your benefits from the Heroes' Feast, and as morning comes, Keyleth gives a rousing speech.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just give us a topic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can just describe the topics you talk about. You don't have to give the actual speech.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's great, because one can only bullshit so much in a four-hour fucking game. I talk about the smell of our breakfast. It's bacon in the morning. And taste and smell the fleshy essence of the pork.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is bacon what we're fighting for?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, bacon is definitely worth fighting for. Bacon is worth fighting for, and when we kill that celestial baby we will have the godliest bacon one could ever imagine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do like bacon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm flashing back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, Voice of the Tempest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bacon. Speech.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, guys. There you go. Take your 17 temporary hit points.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's not a great talker and has never been one. Just want to point that out. You guys all know this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's just her level.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just add that to the 19 then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, because the 17, once the 17 goes it's gone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But the 19 we can heal to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's still your maximum. You can heal to it, yeah. That is the difference.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I always imagine occasionally Keyleth gives a speech that's like what's-his-name from Animal House.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matthew, I'm going to prepare some spells that I'm going to inject into various coins.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, what are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to drop another 300 gold and give Vex another Revivify.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, you're already a good jumper, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far can you jump?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You gave me a Fly coin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, that's gone forever. That's gone. It doesn't last forever. It lasts a couple hours.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, that's bullshit. Yeah, I can jump 15 feet vertically or 20 feet horizontally. So not great. Like three squares.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll give you a Jump coin, so that will triple your jump.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Will you sing "Jump" from Van Halen?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. When you do it. Let's see here. Who needs things?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) Jump! For my love.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no, you guys all cast things now, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not really, why?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Give me a doodad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you turn invisible?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I used to be able to, but I--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You gave away your ring.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kerr bear. Oh no, it wasn't Kerr bear. It was Tova.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll give you a Blur coin.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't you already have that with your--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That cloak that I gave away?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah, that one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's the one that Kerr bear took.

lines.name: LIAM, LAURA
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. (laughs) The inventory of the items you've lost to guests.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Lost? Gave away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lost and gave away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll give good old Percival a Cure Wounds coin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What level?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Level one. You got it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. It will hopefully not come in handy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And also I'm going to change my Robe of Many Things to my new Robe of Many Things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And that's it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A Vest of Several Items now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) The Kigurumi of Useful Trinkets.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, hey. Well, no. Maybe would this be a bad idea? To shoot an Oracle Arrow down into the bottom?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that's been working out very well for us. It is pitch black down there, though, isn't it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. We have this method that we used to do. Light the arrow on fire, and then send it down. So I can see by the light of the fire on it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would that make your actual eyeballs burn?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! And I'm going to do one more thing. I'm going to pull out a healing draught bottle, and give it to-- no, you can heal things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't need to heal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Other people, I normally do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I give it to Vax.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I turn into Nurse Betty almost in every fight. What are you talking about?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that's actually true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true, he does. He does heal people a lot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But that's cool, you give it to somebody that, you know--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was what kind of potion?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A healing draught. It's not a potion; it's a bottle of healing shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's 8d8.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you, Taryon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that that's a really good idea, shooting an arrow down there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to set the Deathwalker's Ward to necrotic.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll light my hands on fire so that Vex can light her arrows on fire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So when we're ready we've got something to light the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. What if we wake it up when I shoot it down and things come out?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, that is a very real possibility.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, then they'll be easier to kill up here than they will be down there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They'll be 400 meters down. I could theoretically drop some awesome Fireballs on their face, potentially.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like this idea. I'm going to cast Pass Without a Trace on all of us, just to be safe. So we can stealth and be quiet. Yeah, but they'll just keep falling, won't they?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How does that work?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a weird magic question.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is why magic freaks me out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the question?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If I drop a Fireball, how long it'll go--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does gravity continue to carry it down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Drop a what? A Fireball?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fire a Fireball into the abyss. Will it just eventually stop?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Will it keep going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, a Fireball is a small bead of magic energy that has a range. So if it reaches the end of the range, it has no effect.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is why magic's weird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But I could Keyteor to the bottom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're just spoiled for choice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take half bludgeoning damage when you impact.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yep, advantages to both.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dropping a great height did not go well for you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keyleth, did you roll 17 or 19 on your--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled 19, but then you get an additional 17 because my weird speech about bacon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bacon points. 17 bacon points.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It will make the most glorious bacon!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just saying.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look, it was inspired, okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, completely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not wrong.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We will not go bacon-less into the night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bacon has saved many a people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. I'm setting my arrow on fire, and I'm shooting it down into the pit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Oracle Arrow. You fire it. It's a big pit. The radius of a small flame on an arrow doesn't seem to light up the walls. It's not bright enough, so it just descends and descends, and the wood is catching and burning, and eventually it hits the stony, earthy floor at the bottom (arrow impact) and it clatters and breaks a little bit. It's burning pretty heavily, and you glance around the space inside and you can see what looks like some broken mining equipment on the ground, jutting out in places. You see what appears to be some sort of stony platform that is carved, but mildly forgotten or eroded steps, and the rest of the arrow burns up and you lose your vision.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was helpful. Super helpful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Worth it. It was worth it. It didn't cost us anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true. I didn't see the great baby beast down at the bottom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Great baby beast is not at the bottom--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Potentially. In that small circle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not at the bottom of the topless pit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so we could take the flying carpet down. A couple of people could fly. We can take the flying carpet down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Two flyers, plus the carpet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The circumference of this thing is massive. The diameter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the diameter of the actual hole is maybe about--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Football field?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not quite that big. I'd say it's about 150, 200 feet across?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stay away from the walls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You think? The skitterers are going to come out of the walls?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, do not come anywhere near the walls.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When we descend, do we want light to be able to see? Or we don't want things to see us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good chance they can see in the dark.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's have the flashlights ready, but not activated.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I have a few Daylight spells.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It may be good to blind them if they dwell under the surface.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, if we're not in a rush-- (deeper) if we're not in a rush, it might just be nice to send a little mini nuke down into the hole and see what comes out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did your voice just crack?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no, it's like reverse puberty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Becoming a man? Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm down with that mini nuke. It extends a lot of our magical ranges, unless I want to Keyteor down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's better, especially-- have we seen a tree that we can port to in case of an emergency? Or some sort of object that we can port to?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There are definitely a lot of trees, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But there will not be a tree down there.

lines.name: LAURA, MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we have an escape route if we need it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have a flying carpet, two brooms, a set of wings. Up and out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just a reminder that I can't ride the carpet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, you can.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a big one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it? Is it bigger than the first one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it's bigger than the first one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So I can get on there with everybody else?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The only people we need to get on it are Percy and Pike. Everybody else can fly. Unless Keyleth is out of--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I can Polymorph him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How much weight can the carpet take?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I mean, you could technically just go on it alone and I could--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hop on the broom.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are versatile as shit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hop on Vax's back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, the flying carpet, the one that you have? 800 pound capacity.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's you, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're 300 pounds, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I'm... it's arguable. I'm definitely over 300.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so three of us on that carpet: one big one, one little one, and a medium.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can fit Grog and one other person.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's a big bastard.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can take someone on a broom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll join you on the broom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think you could probably fit Grog, Percy, and Pike.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, okay then. That solves it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, then let's descend slowly and quietly? Is that what we're doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on. Before we go, there's a few things I want to do. Let me double-check-- I don't want to be a dumbass.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, this is very clever. I see what you're going for.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, one of the things I want to do is I want to use my staff to create an air elemental? So I want to take a minute to use my Spire to conjure an air elemental.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Conjure an air elemental.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: By the way, can I just remind everyone, this whole year I've had one half of a communications bracelet and someone's been watching us the whole time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Remember that thing I found?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because you got that down in the fucking Nine Hells, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Someone's watching us. For a year.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god, they're right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is so crazy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, this channel's boring.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The blondie channel.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's making armor. Ugh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (guttural, growly) I want a blondie so bad!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to conjure an air elemental, and then I'm going to go over to Grog and I'm going to give him a big hug and say, for the next hour, no one can keep a hold of you. And I'm going to give him Freedom of Movement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Target should now spend five feet of movement to automatically escape from non-magical restraints such as manacles or creatures that have grapple.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can't be grappled.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So I just spend five feet of my movement?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're also unaffected by difficult terrain. And spells and other magical effects can neither reduce the target's speed nor cause the target to be paralyzed or restrained.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You are parkour.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're parkour.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm Chevy Chase in Christmas Vacation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because I feel like you've been restrained a lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you finish the conjuration with the staff and slam it into the ground at the edge of the entranceway, you watch as a nearby cloud starts to swirl and descend, and you hear this cracking sound as the planar shift between your plane and the Elemental Plane of Air briefly hiccups open and then summons forth an air elemental that (whoosh) rushes down under your control. It is concentration. Keep that in mind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. Two brooms of flying, magic carpet, wings.

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: (singing) And a partridge in a pear tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you are...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know. I'm wondering if I should ahead and go elemental, but I can't cast. Can I get on the carpet? Is there room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The carpet's full.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll hop on the broom. You hop on the carpet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, we can do that. All right, so you guys slowly begin to descend down this heavy, open tunnel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is just the stupidest. We're sticking to the middle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you cast Pass Without a Trace?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. So I would like all you guys to make a stealth check, please.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit! Flying carpet! Ooh, shit, and add ten, y'all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled a two, but it's a 37.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's ridiculous.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Built into the rules, man!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, reliable rogues, man. That's what rogues are good at.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30, okay! As you guys all descend, you get about halfway down the tunnel, and you can hear this occasional echo (clicking). And for those of you that have Darkvision, you look off to the side and you see there are these small openings, these tunnels in the sides, and occasionally you see a large insect-like creature skitter out (clicking) and then into another hole. None seem to see or notice your presence. You continue delving deeper and deeper and deeper. Looking up above, you can see the slowly vanishing circle of daylight above you, and as you continue further and further down, those of you with Darkvision, you begin to see a floor begin to approach.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't land?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't land.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we need light?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, not yet. I halt the carpet 20 feet off the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You halt the carpet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're definitely whispering over--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can we see any little creature in the middle of anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I look, too?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have some sort of a cloak over my helm, since it emits light always.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It doesn't block all the light because it's the Helm of Brilliance. As you guys are being somewhat stealthy going down here, Taryon is still a slight beacon of fire. His helmet just emits a glow at all times.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cool. Because insects don't love lights in the dark.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 25 for perception.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You glance about and you can see this opening at the bottom. There's some warping to the earth here. It's one large chamber that's almost peanut-shaped, it pinches in the center and closes around, and there's a small tunnel that leads off and then closes at the end. It appears to be what may have been some sort of mine shaft that has then collapsed on the opposite side, but the center here looks like there's some fallen barrels and chest pieces, and there are pieces of rods and rope and cords strewn about. And there's this ancient stone platform that rises up in the center, and what appears to be some sort of a small recess in the stonework there. It looks like it's the size of a football carved downward.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I was wrong. It only emits light when there's undead around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it emitting light? Is it like an orc?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is currently not emitting light.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we just nuke it? Should we just nuke that thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The ancient platform? No, don't do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it was like a coffin. Does it look like a coffin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could probably get closer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's get a little closer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A teeny bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Because you're a ways from it and you have no light down here. Even with your Darkvision, you can make out some details. The closer you get, you see a number of small carvings in what looks like some sort of language that I don't believe you understand.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Celestial?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see it. It's pitch-black for you, Mr. Human.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Abyssal? Draconic?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Primordial?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Common.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would be amazing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Dwarvish. Gnomish.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Giant?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, they're human. They can't see shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The humans are sitting there in pitch black, seeing this tiny little bead of light above and just hoping that someone's going to give them some indicator.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we cast some light down here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. We said that we had prepared our flashlights before, didn't we?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, we have that low-light version! We have the red-light version of it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, we do. I'm going to mark off two of these.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can get around very fast. Why don't I go look?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You want to borrow a flashlight?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a flashlight.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You don't speak Celestial.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can also just cast Daylight, by the by.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that's what we have going in our flashlights, are Daylight spells.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Except they're lensed and contained.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's contained, but it's still a single beam.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A beam of red light.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you go ahead and get close on the broom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And just start to see if I can make out what it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. You open up the hood of the light, and it immediately beams this stark red beam down on this portion, and you look at it. It is Celestial.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What does it say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It appears to be runes of gestation and protection. It speaks of a seed, a guardian for ages to come: Symphior.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Symphior.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It hatched.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So this is the opening of-- this is where it was.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it a guard cherub?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You notice as this pale white light begins to slowly appear a little ways ahead of you in the other side of the chamber. This light is emanating from some--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I snuff. The second.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And we back away from the thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys begin to drift back on the carpet, and you see this beacon of light hovering maybe ten feet up off the ground, about the same height that you guys were to the platform. And you see there what appears to be a cherub. It's a baby, or an infant, but it appears to be withered and gray, and its arms and legs hang limply, and it has these small, white angel-like wings, but the feathers are tattered and broken in places, and the head's lolled back, and as the glow grows from it, it goes (wheezes, screams) and gives out this heinous scream that echoes throughout the whole hall. You can't help but instinctually grab your ears. I would like you all to make a wisdom saving throw, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Advantage on!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which, actually, you are immune to fear, so it does not affect you. However, it shakes the interior and you watch as small stones (thud) hitting the ground around you. You guys, looking up above, you can see that this scream is affecting the structure a little bit. I need you all to roll initiative.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's good!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that sucks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So we have, up here by the platform.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled a 20 on the wisdom save we didn't need to make, and threw it away, and thought, "well, I wanted to keep it," and then I rolled again and I got another natural 20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa, look at that! There's a map.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, it's cool-looking! Oh shit, we're right by the baby.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where's the baby?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There it is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's the baby?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's very tiny.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's a mean baby. I feel like it could be saved, because it's--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When you say saved, do you mean killed?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel bad because it's a baby.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Initiatives. 25 to 20, anybody?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who rolled what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jesus Christ, Percy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So what did you roll?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I rolled a 19, and my initiative is 11.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Jeez.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am going to debate hard how dumb I'm about to be.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The dumbest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So 20 to 15.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What did you get?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You got a 25, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. 15 to 10?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten to five.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. All right, guys, we're going to keep this coming at everyone fast, because we're going to make this happen. All right, first and foremost, as this creature emerges and you guys are in your respective places, Percival, you're up first.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where am I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're up here near the top of the platform, where you saw the recess.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Goddamn it! Okay, so I'm far away from that little bugger, aren't I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it appeared on the opposite side of this double chamber. It's all up from there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to hop off the broom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you hop off of there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, no. You're going to move towards it, I assume?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm so far below you in the initiative, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, that's fair.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's glowing, right, so we can see it even if we don't turn on flashlights and things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see it, yes, but you cannot see the terrain around you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sure we're going to try and talk to it, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Maybe it knows my family's name.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Percival, what are you doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hop off the broom, activate my boots and activate my gloves, and start running through that little choke point, and I'm going to get as close to and possibly on the wall of that choke point as humanly possible. The other side of the choke point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, this side? You can get about there. You don't quite get to the wall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. I can get about there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can get further, but currently the creature is out of your view.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fine. That's as far as I can get right now. That will be just fine. The gloves are charged, the boots are on, and I'm heading towards the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That's your turn?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Vax?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Boots on, I'm going to arc over to ten feet away from the baby.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. About there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Where I am, is it straight up, or am I covered over here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In fact, I'd say, to keep it easier, I'll say that's a collapsed entrance there. But this is all a straight-up hole in the ground. It slowly funnels as it gets to the bottom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to cast Vow of Enmity on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then I'm going to throw Whisper at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 33 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to cast Divine Smite on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job! Kill that celestial baby!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a lot of dice here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get all the bacon!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not very good. 11 plus Divine Smite is 12, 19, plus sneak attack damage. 19, 21, 26, 28, 29, 34, 36, 38. And there's nothing extra because it's celestial, not a fiend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. So that was bonus action, action, I'm going to use my action to then just fly away from the fucking thing, a hundred feet away diagonally up into the tunnel where I can still see it, hopefully. I'm hasted.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Movement was to get there. Bonus action for Vow of Enmity. Action to attack, and then my hasted action I can use for dash, hide, disengage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. Dash is your full movement, which is--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 60 normally, 120 feet hasted. I didn't make these rules or these items. (whoosh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Diagonally up. I'll fly by my sister, how's that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn. All right. Pike, you're up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to cast Beacon of Hope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, sorry. Before the end of your turn, it's going to go ahead and use a legendary action to use a terrain shift.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But it's just a baby!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! We're in its lair!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks over in your direction. The wings flutter once and it brings its arms up, and as it does and you land next to your sister, you feel the air around you begin to freeze in cold. This energy's just (crackling). You feel ice crystals condense around, and both of you feel the air in your lungs suddenly begin to freeze up. I need both of you guys to make constitution saving throws.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks for coming right next to me on that one. Goddamn it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What am I doing, a constitution?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Constitution saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. 19 points of cold damage to you, Vex, and that is nine points of cold damage to you, Vax. And while you manage to pull out of this space of condensed cold, Vax, your sister, however, becomes stunned for one round as your body is frozen and locked in place.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we see any of this happen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike, now it's your turn.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And for my bonus action, I'm going to pull out a spiritual weapon of a giant big greatsword.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A giant baby rattle that's directly in front of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't fight, play with this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a level two spiritual weapon. Where are you putting the spiritual weapon?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Right in front of the baby!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. I believe you get to make an attack with it, then, if you do.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, but I don't know if I want to hurt the baby. Did you do any damage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Once again, roll for attack on that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, that's not very good.

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the end of your turn, the creature goes (raspy breathing) and you watch as the ground right beneath the carpet explodes. It peels back as molten lava suddenly begins to spill up in a column beneath you, splattering up and to the back and over the top of the carpet. I need everybody in this cluster, this ten-foot-by-ten-foot section, to make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: Danger sense 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Danger sense 18.

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.text: The ground below you right now is currently in flames, and you guys have to stick around that space there. The open ground is billowing flame and lava now, and the area around that platform is searing hot. So what did you roll?

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a concentration check. Constitution saving throw.

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A 21 or over.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's 17 plus four?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21. You just maintain concentration.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good roll!

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Nope. This is not a very strong creature.

lines.text: That's what I hoped. They take 3d8 plus two bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll the damage on that, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's nasty. 12 plus seven is 19 plus two, so 21. And they are flung up to 20 feet away from the elemental in a random direction and knocked prone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to fling him 20 feet into the five, ten, 15, 20 into the wall right there, and prone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And are knocked prone.

lines.text: Do I still have line of sight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To it right now, no. You would have to get off the carpet to go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Your old friend, molten lava.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight points of fire damage. And I need you to make another concentration check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no, another concentration check!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm a warcaster, though, man! Because that's eight, so I just have to get over a ten, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Rolled a 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you want to do, Keyleth? You're over here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Can I move over to where I have line of sight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so you leap over and you get line of sight on him right there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, can I do Blight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. What's the DC on that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think my spell level, so 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it's a constitution saving throw, I believe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six plus ten, so it's a 16.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, fail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. So roll your 8d8 necrotic damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, no. Even with advantage on the save, it rolled a six and a four.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One more, and another.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know if I have another.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Give me a d8. Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And you reroll ones, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 28 Blight damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. As you reach, it's on the ground. It's trying to get back up, and its wings are flapping, and all of a sudden you watch as its gray, withered skin turns dark black on one half of its body and it (screech) shrieks out and gives another scream (hoarse scream) from the ground, and the area quakes again, and you feel the ground shimmy a bit. The ground beneath you, as its last legendary action, begins to give way. Keyleth, I need you to make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking lava!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Didn't you move? Wait, no, you moved, didn't you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, this is a different area.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not bad. 19. No, 18?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. So as you finish casting this and you hear it scream, you cover your ears, and suddenly the ground moves out beneath you. You watch as the actual floor (whoosh).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I turn to everyone behind me and I go, aw, fuck!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you watch Keyleth plummet into a pit below. You take eight points of bludgeoning damage and the ground (whoosh) covers over her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth vanishes. The ground seems to swallow her up. Keyleth, the entire pit collapses in on you, and you're currently restrained underground, and you cannot breathe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fixable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you to make another concentration check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: On my elemental?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, 13 plus my constitution, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That ends your turn, Keyleth?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Matt, can you point to where the cherub is?

lines.text: I am, because it's his turn. The cherub creature, this Symphior, begins to fly up off the ground and make its way back in this direction, out into the open once more.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keeps everyone from getting a good night's sleep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He needs a nap.

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's been a thousand years!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You both are still in the flames right there. It's not worried about the fire at the moment. It sees you, Taryon, and goes (hoarse wheezing) and lifts its hands up. I need you to go ahead and make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm feeling lucky. Natural 20! Plus one.

lines.text: It's your turn now.

lines.text: Yeah, I'm frozen.

lines.text: Yay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the casting

lines.text: It lasts a minute. It's instantaneous. You just touch, right?

lines.text: No, is it a bonus action?

lines.text: Oh, damn. It's that whole shit, yo. All right. (grunts) I'm going to jump! And I would like to rage as my bonus action. And with my new Jump coin, I would like to jump with my Boots of Feral Leaping. It's three times my horizontal jump speed, which is 20 feet, so 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You also take seven points of fire damage at the start of your turn, because you're by this flame.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, got it. Nice, that's fine. And can I jump towards the baby? Actually just to the right of the-- just over here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over to this side there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, right there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. I want to get right up on him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're right up on him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Never mind. I'm good. Rage, jump, no more action. Titanstone Knuckles? Next round. Okay.

lines.text: Oh, I do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, no, because you said it's a bonus action to do the leap? What's it say on that? Just to do the leap, right? It was the run. You still have an action.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great weapon master, reckless attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a 26.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice. 12. Where are you? I should have gotten this beforehand. Nice! Plus ten. 37.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I get another one!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have extra attack, man!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24 does not hit. It's a tiny size. It's hard to swing at, and as your axe almost catches it, it (whoosh) out of the way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Good to know. I whiff. That's it. I just have the two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a dexterity check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Saving throw or just dexterity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dexterity saving throw, sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I get two of those. That's better. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ground crumbles beneath you and you suddenly (whoosh) fall below. You are raging. It would've been 12 points of bludgeoning damage, but it becomes six. But you are suddenly buried and restrained underground.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Got that slick stuff on you? Crisco oil?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But that's my next turn. That happens on my turn.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, you burn five feet of movement to get out of it.
